content: again yo draw yarn back around post of st yo draw yarn through two loops on your hook x 2 extr extended treble yo twice insert hook into top of next unless pattern says other location st yo draw yarn through one loop on hook yo draw yarn through two loops on hook x 3 fpextr yo twice insert hook around post of next unless pattern says other location st from front to back to front again yo draw yarn through one loop on hook yo draw yarn through two loops on hook x 3 additional information  all stitches go into the next stitch of previous round unless the pattern says otherwise  square brackets indicate the main repeat you will need to repeat the instructions between the amount of times specified  * * indicate the repeat you will need to repeat the instructions between * * the amount of times specified  parentheses indicate o a group of sts to be worked into the same st/space o a group of sts worked together o additional information  2dc = 2 double_crochet into one st the same applies to any number of any stitches  dc2 = 1 double_crochet into each following 2 sts the same applies to any number of any stitches  ch4 counts as exdc  ch3 counts as double_crochet  ch2 counts as half_double_crochet  ch1 1sc into top chain of beg ch4 or ch3 or ch2 counts as ch2 corner space  1sc into top chain of beg ch2 counts as ch1 corner space  if you feel like or you know that your extended and/or post sts are shorter than regular i advice to replace them with one size taller stitches exdc with treble_crochet extr with dtr fpdc/bpdc with exfpdc/bpexdc fpextr with fpdtr yarn hook & approximate size first sunrise pattern sample was created using the following yarn yarn ice yarns cakes baby fine / blue shades yarn weight #2 fine/sport fiber content 100 % premium acrylic hook size 4 mm g sample size 50 rounds = 30 7 78 cm square amount of yarn used for sample 3 33 skeins = 1311 yds 1199 m 333 g/11 75 oz you can use any yarn & hook you like that suits your project you will find more samples of the pattern in the introduction part on bebablanket blog https //beba-blanket weebly com/patterns/first-sunrise and on ravelry https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/first-sunrise/people ♡ https //linktr ee/bebablanket ♡ 2 color change the pattern is written for a single color but you can use as many colors as you like a new round always starts where you finished the previous one let s start part 1 rounds 1-14 video tutorial https //youtu be/pg_lseiykmq round 1 magic_ring ch2 11hdc into magic_ring tighten magic_ring slip_stitch into top chain of beg ch2 total 12 sts round 2 ch3 1bpdc around ch2 on r1 1dc into next st 1bpdc around the post of same st x 11 slip_stitch into top chain
